def: Consisting chiefly of quartz; containing quartz.
A textualist; a textman. [Obs.]The crabbed textualists of his time. Milton.
Excess; tumult; revelry. [Obs.]His life he led in lawless riotise. Spenser.
pertaining to sanies, or partaking of its nature andappearance; thin and serous, with a slight bloody tinge; as, thesanious matter of an ulcer.
A residence at a particular place accompanied with an intentionto remain there for an unlimited time; a residence accepted as afinal abode. Wharton.
In an intrepid manner; courageously; resolutely.
A figure by which, in pretending to pass over anything, asummary mention of it is made; as, "I will not say, he is valiant, heis learned, he is just." Called also paraleipsis.
Covered with foam; frothy; spumy.Behold how high the foamy billows ride! Dryden.
In a judicious manner; with good judgment; wisely.
